answers.author: Maxwell Moline
answers.text:
Hello Richard,
Fire Truck Preservation is an interesting topic. Once you do receive the grant you're looking for, we'd love to see some before and after pictures here on the Knowledge Network, perhaps in a blog post (http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/blogs/blogpostform)
I found some resources for you on this topic.
First, here's an example of a project like yours that has had some success so far, complete with a description of how they're working toward their funding, from Midlothian, TX (http://www.midlothian.tx.us/index.aspx?NID=456)
SPAAMFAA, The Society for the Preservation of Antique Motor Fire Apparatus in America is a good resource for people who are interested in Fire Truck Preservation.  (http://www.spaamfaa.org/)
A little more specific to your case, Georgia offers Historic Preservation Grants for certified local governments, and this site shows examples of previous grants given, as well as how to apply for one. (http://georgiashpo.org/incentives/grants)
I hope this helps. Please let us know if you have anymore questions or need more information, and we hope to see the results of your project soon!
Max Moline
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA

author: Richard Newbern
text:
Do any members know of any preservation grants available to restore an original 1926 American LaFrance Pumper? I'm Richard Newbern from the City of Brunswick, Georgia. Our Fire Department has an original 1926 American LaFrance Pumber that needs to be completely restored and preserved. We can raise some local funds. Does anyone know of any preservation/resoration grant sources??
Any information would be helpful and most appreciated!
Richard Newbern
City of Brunswick, Georgia
(912) 267-5527
cell (912) 602-2186
title: Historic Fire Truck Preservation
